activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon J Brown

records.addlTxt: Emailed dispatch at 1:44 PM to vacate warrant.

1:41 PM Defendant Devon J Brown in court.  Attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a bail/bond hearing. 
Defendant indicates he forgot about the last court date. 
State does not object to vacating the warrant and reinstating the bond. State puts the offer on the record. 
BTC: VACATE WARRANT and reinstate bond. Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Warrant/capias/commitment entered into all three systems and forwarded to RCSO/Dispatch
Warrant forwarded to JP for entry.

Bond forfeiture notice -

9:37 AM Defendant Devon J Brown not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference.
Defendant does not appear.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited.

records.addlTxt: DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon J Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Devon J Brown. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
